author: El Correo Gallego
title: El tiempo en Palas de Rei: previsión meteorológica para hoy, viernes 29 de diciembre
text:
Hoy en Palas de Rei, se espera un día con cielos cubiertos y lluvia escasa durante la mayor parte del día. La temperatura máxima será de 10 grados , mientras que la mínima será de 7 grados . La sensación térmica será similar a la temperatura real, por lo que no se espera un gran cambio en la percepción del frío.
Durante la mañana, se espera que los cielos estén cubiertos y que haya lluvia escasa. La probabilidad de precipitación será del 100% entre las 01:00 y las 07:00, disminuyendo al 90% entre las 07:00 y las 13:00. La temperatura se mantendrá constante alrededor de los 9 grados , con una sensación térmica similar.
En la tarde, los cielos seguirán cubiertos, pero la lluvia escasa disminuirá. La probabilidad de precipitación será del 60% entre las 13:00 y las 19:00, y del 30% entre las 19:00 y las 01:00 del día siguiente. La temperatura máxima alcanzará los 10 grados , con una sensación térmica similar.
Durante la noche, los cielos estarán nubosos y la probabilidad de precipitación será baja. La temperatura se mantendrá alrededor de los 8 grados , con una sensación térmica similar. Se espera que los vientos sean suaves, con velocidades entre 4 y 8 km/h, provenientes principalmente del este.
En resumen, hoy en Palas de Rei se espera un día con cielos cubiertos y lluvia escasa. Las temperaturas se mantendrán frescas, con máximas de 10 grados y mínimas de 7 grados . Se recomienda llevar paraguas y vestirse abrigado para hacer frente a las condiciones climáticas.
Información elaborada utilizando, entre otras, la obtenida de la
Agencia Estatal de Meteorología. © AEMET. Fecha de actualización de los datos: 2023-12-28T22:44:07

author: NewsBreak Original
title: HEAT ALERT: Another scorcher and high humidity today in NJ; tracking storms for the afternoon and weekend
text:
By Mike Rizzo ,
2 hours ago
"
Storm Watch Team Meteorologist Mike Rizzo says there are numerous heat advisories and heat warnings in effect across the state today for high heat and humidity creating feel like temperatures that exceed 100 degrees. It's another scorcher of a day with high temperatures pushing beyond 100 degrees. There's a better chance for thunderstorms today and Saturday with a piece of upper atmospheric energy aligning itself with the ground-level heat and humidity. Some thunderstorms may produce strong gusts upwards of 40 mph with lightning and downpours capable of producing brief flooding. The storms today arrive by 3 p.m. and move from northwest to southeast across the state. It will cross over the New Jersey Turnpike by 5 p.m. and reach the beaches by 6:30/7 p.m. The storms will exit and dissipate with the sunset by 9 p.m. Saturday is a repeat of today with the same chances for afternoon and evening storms. Sunday looks a bit better, with fewer storms and slightly cooler weather, but still very warm with highs in the upper 80s. Weather early next week looks good but the forecast for the late week is subject to change based on how a tropical disturbance develops over Florida this weekend. " Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Columbia County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Columbia County, Pennsylvania from 1901-2000 was 28.2. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Columbia County, Pennsylvania experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Columbia County, Pennsylvania history.

author: Devesh K. Pandey
title: NIA chargesheets two alleged aides of Canada-based ‘terrorist’ Arsh Dalla - The Hindu
text:
The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Thursday filed a chargesheet against alleged Khalistan Tiger Force (KTF) members Manpreet Singh alias Peeta and Mandeep Singh, who were recently deported from the Philippines at its instance.
The NIA has named the two as associates of Canada-based “listed individual terrorist” Arshdeep Singh alias Arsh Dalla, in its second supplementary chargesheet. “Dalla had recruited Peeta and Mandeep Singh, who were operating from the Philippines on his directions,” the NIA has said.
The NIA alleged that the two were actively involved in recruiting the youth into Dalla’s terror and crime syndicate. “They were playing a vital role in the larger terror conspiracy against India by raising funds for the proscribed terrorist organisation, KTF, through large-scale extortions in India, and channelling that money into drug and other businesses and trades and to various countries through the ‘hawala’ network. They were involved in smuggling arms and ammunition from Pakistan into the Indian territory,” said the NIA.
The agency said that Dalla, in collusion with Peeta, had recruited criminal elements and terror operatives and formed a full-fledged syndicate in Punjab. They targeted businessmen, high net-worth individuals and professionals, terrorised them by opening fire in front of their houses and extorted protection money from them. The extortion money was sent to various foreign countries through banking and non-banking channels, it is alleged.
In July and November last year, the NIA had filed chargesheets against 13 accused persons. The probe against 10 other accused and their aides, who are associates with Babbar Khalsa International and KTF, is in progress.
